item.title: Rubbish and dumped household goods in bin area, 16th June
item.description:
Holes in the concrete which is now causing a rat issue in the neighbourhood. Pest control have been out to my privately rented house and investigated. I have emailed the council and councillor. The holes in the concrete need to be sorted and something needs to be done about the bins always having rubbish overflowing. Itâ€™s disgusting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Albert Road, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Skip left in front of garage. Cannot access with vehicle, 16th June
item.description:
4 Farnham Court cleaned out their garden and as a result a skip has been left. This was 2 weeks ago and it is still here. I called the skip company and they are unaware of it being here and said they would need a license to park it there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hindhead Close, Hackney, London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Matham Grove, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Human excrement in Caldew Street, 16th June
item.description:
Caldew is used regularly as a lavatory, usually it is just men urinating but recently excrement has started to appear. I have tried dousing it with Jeyes powder but that has not really worked. I would like the Council to remove it. I think it is essential that Southwark Council provide public toilets down this end of Burgess Park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Addington Square, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead squirrel (double-bagged) near street, 16th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Valley Road, Poverest, Orpington, London

item.title: Uneven footpath / trip hazzard, 16th June
item.description:
There were some cracks in this footpath caused by the roots of the tree, but the job that has been done to fill them in is very poor. Tarmac has been dumped over the cracks and no attempt has been made to even the footpath out, or to smooth the new tarmac over the existing footpath. The new tarmac is in random locations and is raised, causing a trip hazard. The state of the footpath on Matham Grove is generally very poor - it must surely be time for it to be replaced by the counsel like surrounding streets.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Matham Grove, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
